title: For Loop
description: Use a for loop to build a snake with ease.

steps.hint: We're going to recreate the classic game Snake using the power of For Loops. First let's set a dirt background**type** `background tan`
First we position the head of the snake **type** `moveTo 80,250`
Draw an `circle` 30 pixels big for the head

This is where we will set the loop up, using the for function, the first number is where to start counting from and the second number is what to count to. So 1 .. 7 makes the computer count to 7  - **type** `for [1 .. 7]`
Everything within this indent will be repeated 7 times, we need a move function to position each part of the body - **type** `move 50,0`
We set the body color - **type** `color olivedrab`
Once we add a circle it'll be clear what is going on with the code being repeated several times - **type** `circle 30`
Let's add a square so the body looks more segmented, notice how we're now drawing 7 shapes for every line of code - **type** `square 30`
We're going to add another detail to the tail so set the `color` to darkgreen
Draw another circle, the code is still indented this will be repeated 7 times - **type** `circle 20`
First make sure you are no longer in the for loop by hitting backspace so we're no longer indented. - **type** `moveTo 70,240`
Draw an `ellipse` 10 pixels wide and 5 tall.
Finally we'll give it a tongue so it can hiss like a snake should - **type** `color salmon`
We'll draw a rectangle with a negative width to stretch it out from the mouth - **type** `rectangle -20,4`

completion_text: Now you have seen how we can create more art with less lines of code by using loops in clever ways, why not try changing the 7 in the for loop and see what happenes
